hints.content:
The bottom bar lines up to $\purpleD{5}$.   

![A horizontal bar graph. Number is on the horizontal axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Shape is on the vertical axis.  There are bars for each of the Shapes. The bottom bar is 5. The second bar is 3. The third bar is 9. The fourth bar is 4. The bottom bar is labeled 5 at the right.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a76041cbf730e35c0b5df91022634dd6f93b9882)

Which shape does Farris have $\purpleD{5}$ of?

Shape type | Number 
:- | :-: 
Square | $5$ 

Farris has $\purpleD{5}$ squares.  So, the bottom bar should be labeled $\purpleD{\text{Squares}}$.
Now let's label the other bars to match the table.

Here is the completed graph:

![A horizontal bar graph. Number is on the horizontal axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Shape is on the vertical axis.  There are bars for each of the Shapes. The bottom bar labeled Squares is 5. The second bar labeled Circles is 3. The third bar labeled Rectangles is 9. The fourth bar labeled Triangles is 4.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7389c3c765d9e23b9a59472556601a65a57c6424)

question.content:
Farris created a chart and a bar graph to show how many different types of shapes she has.

Shape type | Number 
:- | :-: 
Circles | $3$ 
Triangles | $4$ 
Rectangles | $9$ 
Squares | $5$ 

**Label each bar on the bar graph.**

[[â˜ƒ label-image 1]]

options.imageAlt: A horizontal bar graph. Number is on the horizontal axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Shape is on the vertical axis.  There are bars for each of the Shapes. The bottom bar is 5. The second bar is 3. The third bar is 9. The fourth bar is 4.
